intro: Petrea rugosa f. casta, commonly known as the pink flame tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to reddish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a woody stem with a smooth, greyish-brown bark and large, heart-shaped leaves that are often lobed. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental planting in warm climates. The flowers are not only visually striking but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
